result.execSummary:
The defendant Kareen R Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge
Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge - denied
Status conference at 10-23-2015 12:30 pm

Defendant Kareen R Hayes in court, in custody, with attorney Joanne M. Keane.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard, rec'v 2 documents from counsel. Atty Keane heard on status us matter, have reached an agreement w/ state regarding plea portion, prior to hearing being called, Atty Sempf shared some info. In light of new info rec'v, court give consel 10 mins to discuss. Court in recess. 9:34 am. Court back on record 9:42 am, appearances are the same. Atty Keane heard, states Def. wishes for her to withdraw as counsel due to communication break down. Def. heard, understands right to represents himself, questions ct. regarding subpoenaing witnesses. Discussion held. Ct. addresses Def. on representing himself. Def. heard, does not want a JT, would like a CT. Ct. questions Def. regarding Atty Keane w/d as counsel. Def. heard, wishes for Atty Keane to w/d. Ct. further addresses Def. regarding representing himself. Atty Sempf heard, states this is the 2nd time that Def. has requested his counsel w/d, but takes no stance on matter. Ct. heard, grants requests by Def. - Atty Keane may w/d, Atty Keane to draft order regarding w/d, and forward to DAs office. Ct. heard, does not grant request by Def. to represent himself at this time, will not accept waiver of counsel. Def. heard. Ct. heard, Def. is to apply at SPD office for a 3rd time, Court will schedule another hearing.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 12:30 pm. Ct. will keep trial on calendar, and NOH to be sent to SPD offices to inform them of date in the event a 3rd atty is appointed.

Defendant Kareen R Hayes in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held as to status. Atty Jansen requesting appointment of another attorney throught SPD and his withdrawal. Defendant heard on request of withdraw. Discussion. Court heard and grants withdraw of Atty Jansen; takes JT off calendar at this time and schedules TSC to determine scheduling. Court instructs Atty Jansen to notify SPD and submit Order for same. Atty Jansen's copy of TSC to go to SPD Office for Notification of new counsel. Defendant to be added as phone party to participate in TSC.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Motion hearing at 06-22-2015 02:45 pm

Defendant Kareen R Hayes in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Ct. did receive correspondence from Def. and provided a copy to counsel. Def. requested a different attorney. Ct. will not remove the trial due to speedy trial demand. Atty Jansen heard, filed a Motion to Withdraw last week. Ct. heard, discusses Def. letter. Atty Jansen heard, would be prepared for the trial. Ct. heard, trial will be held as scheduled. Def. heard, waives right to a speedy trial. Discussion held. Ct. heard, denies request for substitution of counsel. Discussion held. Atty Jansen heard, believes Def. wishes to continue the trial. Ct. heard, victim was not noticed for this hearing, court reschedules and orders the victim coordinator contact the victim; this matter is continued. Atty Sempf heard, has not received any discovery from the defense.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
